description: IPsec packets with invalid hashes were found in an inbound
ESP SA. The total number of authentication errors
accumulated is sent for the specific row of the
'ipsecSaEspInTable' table for the SA; this provides the
identity of the SA in which the error occurred.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Invalid hashes found in IPsec packets from inbound ESP SA

description: The number of packets discarded by the SA due to
authentication errors.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSaEspInAuthErrors

description: IPsec packets with invalid hashes were found in an inbound
AH SA. The total number of authentication errors accumulated
is sent for the specific row of the 'ipsecSaAhInTable' table
for the SA; this provides the identity of the SA in which
the error occurred.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Invalid hashes found in IPsec packets from inbound AH SA

description: The number of packets discarded by the SA due to
authentication errors.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSaAhInAuthErrors

description: IPsec packets with invalid sequence numbers were found in
an inbound ESP SA. The total number of replay errors
accumulated is sent for the specific row of the
'ipsecSaEspInTable' table for the SA; this provides the
identity of the SA in which the error occurred.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Invalid sequence numbers found in IPsec packets from inbound ESP SA

description: The number of packets discarded by the SA due to replay
errors.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSaEspInReplayErrors

description: IPsec packets with invalid sequence numbers were found in
the specified AH SA. The total number of replay errors
accumulated is sent for the specific row of the
'ipsecSaAhInTable' table for the SA; this provides the
identity of the SA in which the error occurred.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Invalid sequence numbers found in IPsec packets from inbound AH SA

description: The number of packets discarded by the SA due to replay
errors.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSaAhInReplayErrors

description: IPsec packets carrying packets with invalid selectors for
the specified ESP SA were found. The total number of policy
errors accumulated is sent for the specific row of the
'ipsecSaEspInTable' table for the SA; this provides the
identity of the SA in which the error occurred.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Invalid selectors found in IPsec packets from inbound ESP SA

description: The number of packets discarded by the SA due to policy
errors. This includes packets where the next protocol is
invalid.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSaEspInPolicyErrors

description: IPsec packets carrying packets with invalid selectors for
the specified AH SA were found. The total number of policy
errors accumulated is sent for the specific row of the
'ipsecSaAhInTable' table for the SA; this provides the
identity of the SA in which the error occurred.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Invalid selectors found in IPsec packets from inbound AH SA

description: The number of packets discarded by the SA due to policy
errors. This includes packets where the next protocol is
invalid.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSaAhInPolicyErrors

description: A packet with an unknown SPI was detected from the
specified peer with the specified SPI using the specified
protocol. The destination address of the received packet is
specified by 'ipsecLocalAddress'.
The value 'ifIndex' may be 0 if this optional linkage is
unsupported.
If the object 'ipsecSecurityProtocol' has the value for
IPcomp, then the 'ipsecSPI' object is the CPI of the packet.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per peer (within a
reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per
packet.

event.Summary: Unknown SPI $v4 detected in packet from peer $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::espInvalidSpiTrap IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecLocalAddress s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSecurityProtocol i 0 IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecPeerAddress s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSPI u 9999 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: A local IP address associated with the trap.
IPv4 entities will prefix the IP address with
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecLocalAddress

description: A security protocol associated with the trap.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSecurityProtocol

description: A peer IP address associated with the trap.
IPv4 entities will prefix the IP address with
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecPeerAddress

description: An SPI associated with a trap. Where the security protocol
associated with the trap is IPcomp, this value has a maximum
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecSPI

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Clear packets were found that should not have been sent to
the entity in the clear. The total number of policy errors
accumulated by the entity is sent, along with the source and
destination addresses of the packet that triggered the trap.
Implementations SHOULD send one trap per source address pair
(within a reasonable time period), rather than sending one
trap per packet.

event.Summary: Clear packets sent to entity that should not be in clear

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::otherPolicyFailureTrap IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecPolicyErrors c 9999 IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecPeerAddress s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecLocalAddress s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX

description: The total number of packets received by the entity in SAs
since boot time and discarded due to policy errors. This
includes packets that had selectors that were invalid for
the SA that carried them, and also includes packets that
arrived at the entity in the clear and that should have been
protected by IPsec or should have been dropped.
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecPolicyErrors

description: A peer IP address associated with the trap.
IPv4 entities will prefix the IP address with
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecPeerAddress

description: A local IP address associated with the trap.
IPv4 entities will prefix the IP address with
variables.name: IPSEC-SA-MON-MIB::ipsecLocalAddress
